choices.name: Get started with research for your Oklahoma ancestors.

hidden.content:
• Learn successful research strategies for Oklahoma ancestors.
  • Record Finder: Use the Record Finder to determine records for Oklahoma research.

content.text:
1. Introduction: Learn about basic Oklahoma research strategies.

    ☆ FS—Basic Oklahoma Research Tips and Strategies
    ☆ FS—Oklahoma Research

  2. Follow this research study for Oklahoma ancestors, from 1880 to the present.

    ☆ FS—Step-by-Step Oklahoma Research, 1880-Present

  3. Watch this video for ideas on Oklahoma research.

    ☆ FS—United States Research: Great Plains Region - Oklahoma—3:17

  4. Resources: Explore resources for Oklahoma research on Ancestry.

    ☆ AC—Oklahoma Resources
    ☆ AC—Oklahoma State Research Guide, 5 pgs.

  5. Learn about online resources for Oklahoma research.

    ☆ PR—Oklahoma Genealogy Treasures

  6. Record Finder: Use the Oklahoma Record Finder to decide on records to search.

    ☆ FS—Oklahoma Record Finder

    7. Additional Records
    1. Explore a variety of records on the ☆LDSGenealogy site.
    2. Explore historical photo sites on ☆Ancestor Hunt.
    3. Explore resources for school yearbooks on the ☆Ancestor Hunt site.

    Ethnic
    1. African American: Learn about African Americans in Oklahoma in this FamilySearch Wiki article.

      ☆ FS—Wiki: African American Resources for Oklahoma

    2. Learn more about African American records.

      ☆ AG—Oklahoma African American Records

    3. Explore the African American Gateway for Oklahoma.
    4. Native American: Learn about American Indians in Oklahoma in these articles.

      ☆ FS—Wiki: Indians of Oklahoma
      ☆ Finding Your American Indian Ancestors


Additional Records
  1. Explore a variety of records on the ☆LDSGenealogy site.
  2. Explore historical photo sites on ☆Ancestor Hunt.
  3. Explore resources for school yearbooks on the ☆Ancestor Hunt site.
Ethnic
  1. African American: Learn about African Americans in Oklahoma in this FamilySearch Wiki article.

    ☆ FS—Wiki: African American Resources for Oklahoma

  2. Learn more about African American records.

    ☆ AG—Oklahoma African American Records

  3. Explore the African American Gateway for Oklahoma.
  4. Native American: Learn about American Indians in Oklahoma in these articles.

    ☆ FS—Wiki: Indians of Oklahoma
    ☆ Finding Your American Indian Ancestors

1. Explore Oklahoma historical resources on FamilySearch.

    ☆ FS—Oklahoma History

  2. Explore Oklahoma history on Wikipedia.

    ☆ History
    ☆ History of Oklahoma

  3. Learn about Oklahoma history on InfoPlease.com.

    ☆ Oklahoma History

choices.name: Learn about Oklahoma archives and libraries.

hidden.content:
• Explore statewide and regional collections.
  • Explore books and photos that can be helpful in your research.

• * Good: Using the articles and videos in this Choice, write down key learnings for archives and libraries. Then use the learnings for searches for a U.S. ancestor.
  • * Proficient: Same as above, for two or more ancestors.

content.text:
1. Learn about Oklahoma archives and libraries in these articles.

    ☆ FS—Wiki: Oklahoma Archives and Libraries
    ☆ Oklahoma State Archives: Wonderful Local Sources for Genealogical Research

  2. Explore the State Archives and Libraries site for Oklahoma.
  3. Explore the Oklahoma Dept. of Archives collection.
  4. Explore the Oklahoma Digital Prairie site collection.
  5. Explore the ☆Books We Own site for Oklahoma genealogy publications. Volunteers may be available for lookup services.
  6. Search for ☆free online books on Oklahoma research on the FamilySearch site.
  7. Photos: Explore historical photo resources on the ☆Ancestor Hunt site.

hidden.content:
• Explore city and county directories to find Oklahoma ancestors.
  • Discover the different types of information in directories, such as streets, churches, historical info, etc.

• * Good: Using the articles and videos in this Choice, write down key learnings for city directories. Then use the learnings for searches for a U.S. ancestor.
  • * Proficient: Same as above, for two or more ancestors.

content.text:
1. Learn about Oklahoma city directories in this FamilySearch Wiki article.

    ☆ FS—Wiki: Oklahoma Directories

  2. Sites: Explore Oklahoma city directories on the Ancestor Hunt site.
  3. Find out more about city directories in this research guide from Ancestry.

    ☆ AC—Six Things to Find—3 pgs.

  4. Explore Oklahoma city directories on the ☆Ancestry site.
  5. Explore Oklahoma ☆historical directories by county.
  6. Explore additional links for Oklahoma city directories on the ☆LDSGenealogy site.

hidden.content:
• Find online resources for vital records.
  • Learn the history of vital records in the state of Oklahoma.
  • Learn about alternates for vital records in Oklahoma.

• * Good: Using the articles and videos in this Choice, write down key learnings for vital records. Then use the learnings for searches for a U.S. ancestor.
  • * Proficient: Same as above, for two or more ancestors.

content.text:
1. Learn about Oklahoma vital records in these articles.

    ☆ FS—Wiki: Oklahoma Vital Records
    ☆ AC—Wiki: Oklahoma Vital Records

  2. Search for Oklahoma vital records on the OK2Explore site.
  3. Explore links for vital records on the Oklahoma Public Health site.
  4. Search for online Oklahoma ☆vital records and find addresses for state offices to write to for records.
  5. Explore Oklahoma birth, marriage, and death records on the ☆AccessGenealogy site.
  6. Explore additional links for Oklahoma vital records on the ☆Linkpendium site.

hidden.content: • Find birth records for Oklahoma ancestors.

• * Good: Using the articles and videos in this Choice, write down key learnings for birth and adoption records. Then use the learnings for searches for a U.S. ancestor.
  • * Proficient: Same as above, for two or more ancestors.

content.text:
1. Learn how to find Oklahoma birth records in this article.

    ☆ FS—Wiki: How to Find Oklahoma Birth Records

  2. Explore additional links for Oklahoma birth records on the ☆LDSGenealogy site.

hidden.content: • Find marriage records for Oklahoma ancestors.

• * Good: Using the articles and videos in this Choice, write down key learnings for marriage and divorce records. Then use the learnings for searches for a U.S. ancestor.
  • * Proficient: Same as above, for two or more ancestors.

content.text:
1. Learn how to find Oklahoma marriage records with FamilySearch.
  2. Explore links for Oklahoma marriage records.
  3. Explore additional links for Oklahoma marriage records on the ☆LDSGenealogy site.

QUIKLinks

choices.name: Explore Oklahoma obituaries and death records.

hidden.content:
• Find obituaries for Oklahoma ancestors.
  • Find death records and death indexes for Oklahoma ancestors.

• * Good: Using the articles and videos in this Choice, write down key learnings for obituary and death records. Then use the learnings for searches for a U.S. ancestor.
  • * Proficient: Same as above, for two or more ancestors.

content.text:
1. Explore the ObituariesHelp site for Oklahoma obituaries.
  2. Explore The Ancestor Hunt for obituaries.
  3. Search for obituaries by county on the Newspaperobituaries.net site.
  4. Find additional resources for Oklahoma obituaries on the ☆Linkpendium site.
Oklahoma Death Records
  1. Explore Oklahoma death records, indexes, and obituaries.
  2. Learn how to find Oklahoma death records in this article.

    ☆ FS—Wiki: How to Find Oklahoma Death Records

  3. Explore additional links for Oklahoma death records on the ☆LDSGenealogy site.
  4. Explore the Ancestors at Rest site for Oklahoma death records.

QUIKLinks

choices.name: Explore Oklahoma census and voter records.

hidden.content:
• Explore state and county census records for Oklahoma ancestors.
  • Find voter registration records in Oklahoma.

• * Good: Using the articles and videos in this Choice, write down key learnings for census and voter records. Then use the learnings for searches for a U.S. ancestor.
  • * Proficient: Same as above, for two or more ancestors.

content.text:
1. Get an overview of Oklahoma censuses in this article.

    ☆ FS—Oklahoma Census

  2. Explore the MyFreeCensus site for Oklahoma state and county census records.
  3. Explore additional links for Oklahoma census records on the ☆LDSGenealogy site.
  4. Explore Oklahoma census records on the ☆AccessGenealogy site.
  5. Learn about Oklahoma voting registers in these articles.

    ☆ FS—Oklahoma Voting Registers

QUIKLinks

hidden.content: • Find cemetery records for Oklahoma ancestors from a number of sources.

• * Good: Using the articles and videos in this Choice, write down key learnings for cemetery records. Then use the learnings for searches for a U.S. ancestor.
  • * Proficient: Same as above, for two or more ancestors.

content.text:
1. Explore Oklahoma cemetery records in this article.

    ☆ FS—Oklahoma Cemetery Records

  2. Browse the ☆Interment.net site for Oklahoma cemetery records.
  3. Search for Oklahoma cemetery records online.
  4. Explore Oklahoma cemetery records on the ☆AccessGenealogy site.
  5. Explore additional links for Oklahoma cemetery records on the ☆LDSGenealogy site.
  6. Explore the ☆Tombstone Transcription Project on the U.S. GenWeb site.
  7. Search the ☆Find A Grave site for cemetery records.
  8. Search the ☆BillionGraves site for cemetery records.
  9. See additional cemetery resources on the Oklahoma ☆Linkpendium site.
  10. Explore ☆African American cemetery records in Oklahoma.

  • Learn about the history of land and property claims in Oklahoma.

• * Good: Using the articles or videos in this Choice, write down key learnings for probate and court records. Then use the learnings for searches for a U.S. ancestor.
  • * Proficient: Same as above, for two or more ancestors.

content.text:
1. Learn about Oklahoma probate records in these articles.

    ☆ FS—Wiki: Oklahoma Probate Records
    ☆ AC—Wiki: Oklahoma Probate Records

  2. Explore additional links for Oklahoma probate records on the ☆LDSGenealogy site.
  3. Explore probate records and wills on the ☆Ancestor Hunt site.
  4. Learn about Oklahoma land and property records.

    FS—Oklahoma Land and Property Records
    ☆ AC—Oklahoma Land Records

  5. Learn about homesteading and land entry case files.

    ☆ FS—Land Runs, Lotteries, and Homesteading in Oklahoma—48:39

  6. Explore additional links for Oklahoma land records on the ☆LDSGenealogy site.

QUIKLinks

hidden.content: • Learn about the history of court records in Oklahoma and where to find them.

content.text:
1. Learn about Oklahoma court records in these articles.

    ☆ FS—Wiki: Oklahoma Court Records
    ☆ AC—Wiki: Oklahoma Court Records
  2. Explore records for district and circuit courts on the National Archives site.
  3. Explore school record resources on the ☆Ancestor Hunt site.
  4. Explore resources for orphans on the OrphanFinder site.

choices.name: Learn about Oklahoma maps and gazetteers.

hidden.content:
• Learn about the history of Oklahoma maps.
  • Find out how Oklahoma gazetteers can help you in your research.

content.text:
1. Learn about Oklahoma maps in these articles.

    ☆ FS—Wiki: Oklahoma Maps
    ☆ AC—Wiki: Oklahoma Maps

  2. Learn about Oklahoma gazetteers in this FamilySearch Wiki article.

    ☆ FS—Wiki: Oklahoma Gazetteers

  3. Access interactive maps and atlases of Oklahoma on the ☆MapsofUS site.
  4. Find Oklahoma towns and communities on the RoadsideThoughts site.

hidden.content:
• * Good: Using the articles and videos in this Choice, write down key learnings for maps and gazetteers. Then use the learnings for searches for a U.S. ancestor.
  • * Proficient: Same as above, for two or more ancestors.

content.text:
1. Explore the ☆David Rumsey collection of Oklahoma maps.
  2. Explore the ☆Perry-Castaneda site for maps of Oklahoma.
  3. Explore historical Oklahoma maps on the Historic Map Works site.
  4. Explore the ☆Old Maps Online site for Oklahoma maps.
  5. Explore the ☆Old Maps of Oklahoma on the Wikipedia site.

hidden.content:
• Discover the history of Oklahoma newspapers.
  • Learn more about how to use Oklahoma periodical and manuscripts.

content.text:
1. Learn about Oklahoma newspapers in these articles.

    ☆ FS—Wiki: Oklahoma Newspapers
    ☆ AC—Wiki: Oklahoma Periodicals, Newspapers, and Manuscripts

  2. Learn about researching historical Oklahoma newspapers in this tutorial from The Ancestor Hunt.

    ☆ Research Free Historical Oklahoma Newspapers—11:28

hidden.content:
• Find research clues in the Library of Congress historical newspaper collection.
  • Search Oklahoma online newspaper sites.

• * Good: Using the articles and videos in this Choice, write down key learnings for newspaper records. Then use the learnings for searches for a U.S. ancestor.
  • * Proficient: Same as above, for two or more ancestors.

content.text:
1. Search for ☆Oklahoma historical newspapers in the Library of Congress collection.
  2. Find links to Oklahoma newspapers on the Wikipedia site.
  3. Search the Oklahoma Online Historical Newspapers site.
  4. Explore Oklahoma newspaper resources on the ☆Ancestor Hunt site.
  5. See additional Oklahoma newspaper resources on the Linkpendium site.
  6. Explore additional links for Oklahoma newspapers and obituaries on the ☆LDSGenealogy site.

choices.name: Use Facebook pages to get answers to your questions.

content.text:
1. Visit the Oklahoma Genealogy Network page on Facebook.
  2. Visit the Oklahoma Genealogy page on Facebook.
  3. Visit the Oklahoma Genealogical Society page on Facebook.
  4. Visit the U.S. South Genealogy Research page on Facebook.
  5. See the Genealogy on Facebook list of Facebook groups dedicated to helping with research for Oklahoma.

1. Join the RootsChat forum and post questions about Oklahoma research.
  2. Explore the Oklahoma research mailing lists on Cyndi's List.
  3. Use the ☆Ancestry message boards to read or post questions about Oklahoma research.

hidden.content: • * Proficient: Make a list of Facebook groups, mailing lists, and genealogy societies of interest, and then join or subscribe to them.

content.text:
1. Learn about genealogy societies in Oklahoma in this FamilySearch Wiki article.

    ☆ FS—Wiki: Oklahoma Societies

  2. Explore the Oklahoma Genealogical Society site.
  3. Explore the Oklahoma Historical Society site.
  4. Explore Oklahoma genealogy society sites on Cyndi's List.
  5. Get help at a family history center in Oklahoma.
